title: 2012–13 European Challenge Cup pool stage
text:
The 2012–13 Amlin Challenge Cup pool stage was the opening stage of the 17th season of the <a href="European%20Challenge%20Cup">European Challenge Cup</a>, the second-tier competition for European <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> clubs. It began with a match between <a href="Stade%20Montois">Mont-de-Marsan</a> and <a href="Gloucester%20Rugby">Gloucester</a> on Thursday 11 October 2012 and ended on 19 January 2013 when <a href="Stade%20Fran%C3%A7ais">Stade Français</a> hosted competition newcomers <a href="London%20Welsh%20RFC">London Welsh</a>.
Twenty teams participated in this phase of the competition; they were divided into five pools of four teams each, with each team playing the others home and away. Competition points are earned using the standard <a href="rugby%20union%20bonus%20points%20system">bonus point system</a>. The pool winners advanced to the knockout stage, where they were joined by three entrants from the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Heineken%20Cup%20pool%20stage">Heineken Cup pool stage</a>. These teams then competed in a single-elimination tournament that ended with the final at the <a href="RDS%20Arena">RDS Arena</a> in <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a> on 17 May 2012.
Results.
All times are local to the game location.
